cs.IT, cs.CR, cs.DM, cs.CC, cs.SI. 

The paper deals with linear codes, which are a topic in information theory (cs.IT) and cryptography (cs.CR). The use of Gauss periods suggests a connection to number theory and algebraic geometry, which are also relevant to coding theory and cryptography. The mention of secret sharing schemes suggests a connection to discrete mathematics (cs.DM) and access control (cs.CC). Finally, the paper's focus on practical applications suggests a connection to systems and networking (cs.SI).
